intro: Habranthus hesperius var. advena, commonly known as the desert bell, is a flowering plant native to the southwestern United States and northern Mexico. It is characterized by its striking, bell-shaped flowers that range in color from white to pink and violet. The plant typically grows in arid or semi-arid environments, adapting to harsh conditions with its succulent leaves and deep root system. It belongs to the Acanthaceae family and is often found in rocky soils along canyons and riverbanks. Its blooming period usually occurs in the spring and early summer, adding a vibrant touch to its natural habitat.
